required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Registry Study for Pregnant Women With Iodine Overload
clinical_study.official_title: Registry Study on Effect of Excessive Iodine Exposure on Maternal and Fetal Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Pre-gestational performance of hysterosalpingography (HSG) using an oil-soluble iodinated contrast medium has been demonstrated to be the main cause of excessive iodine exposure for pregnant women. However, its long-term health effects on the mothers and offsprings have not been adequately elucidated. A case registry study is designed to follow up all the pregnant women with pre-gestational history of ethiodized-oil HSG examination and try to keep track of maternal and fetal outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive pregnant outcomes_prevalence of gestational diabetes
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the whole pregnancy, from date of verification of pregnancy until the date of termination of pregnancy, assessed up to 10 months

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive pregnant outcomes_prevalence of gestational hypertension
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the whole pregnancy, from date of verification of pregnancy until the date of termination of pregnancy, assessed up to 10 months

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive pregnant outcomes_prevalence of abnormal pregnancy
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the whole pregnancy, from date of verification of pregnancy until the date of termination of pregnancy, assessed up to 10 months
primary_outcome.description: prevalence of abnormal pregnancy (stillbirth, abortion, premature delivery)

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive pregnant outcomes_rate of cesarean section
comprehensive neonatal outcomes_prevalence of macrosomia or underweight

primary_outcome.time_frame: from birth to age of 1 year old, assessed every 6 months
primary_outcome.description: prevalence of thyroid dysfunction (hyperthyroidism or hypothyroidism)

primary_outcome.measure: offspring outcomes_neurodevelopment evaluation in long term
primary_outcome.time_frame: from birth to age of 1 year old, assessed every 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Norwegian version of the Ages and Stages Questionnaire (ASQ) scores for evaluation of infant neurodevelopment

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive offspring outcomes in long term - weight evaluation
primary_outcome.time_frame: from birth to age of 1 year old, assessed every 3-6 months

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive offspring outcomes in long term - height evaluation
primary_outcome.time_frame: from birth to age of 1 year old, assessed every 3-6 months

primary_outcome.measure: comprehensive offspring outcomes in long term - BMI evaluation
primary_outcome.time_frame: from birth to age of 1 year old, assessed every 3-6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: prevalence of thyroid dysfunction in pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the whole pregnancy, from date of verification of pregnancy until the date of termination of pregnancy, assessed up to 10 months
secondary_outcome.description: evaluation of maternal TSH, T3, T4, FT3, FT4, TRAb,Tg-Ab, TPO-Ab

secondary_outcome.measure: prevalence of iodine overload in neonates
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 week after birth of neonates
secondary_outcome.description: prevalence of infants with urinary iodine concentration ≥200μg/L

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pregnant women with pre-gestational HSG history
arm_group.description: All enrolled pregnant women with pre-gestational ethiodized-oil HSG will be followed up without grouping and be kept track for maternal and offspring's health outcomes in this case registry study.

intervention.intervention_name: dietary iodine restriction on subjects with iodine overload
intervention.description: In this case registry study (observational study),all intervention will be performed not for research purposes, but only part of routine treatment, which will be recorded in database of the registry study.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pregnant women with pre-gestational HSG history

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women with excessive iodine exposure caused by pre-gestational ethiodized-oil HSG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Must be pregnant when enrolled in this study. Must have undergone examination of ethiodized-oil HSG before this pregnancy. Clinical diagnosis of iodine excess (with the mean urine iodine concentration ≥250μg/L and the serum iodine concentration ＞92μg/L).
Exclusion Criteria:
Having past history of partial or total resection of thyroid glands. Having medical history of thyroid dysfunction before ethiodized-oil HSG examination.
